Paragraphs.Text: Speedometer Refer to: R39 00-R1/C1

Similar Paragraphs.Text: The reference temperature at the speedometer shall be 23 ± 5 °C;
‘Speedometer’ means that part of the speedometer equipment which indicates to the driver the speed of his vehicle at any given moment; (2)

Paragraphs.Text: Effective date and Scope:

Similar Paragraphs.Text: SCOPE This Regulation applies to the approval of vehicles of categories L, M and N.
Consider that the modifications made are unlikely to have an appreciable adverse effect and that in any case the vehicle still meets the requirements; or
The Type Approval Authority shall verify the existence of satisfactory arrangements for ensuring effective control of the conformity of production before type approval is granted.

Paragraphs.Text: Effective date from 2006/7/1, the new vehicle variants of category symbols M1, N1, L1 and L3, and from 2008/7/1 all vehicle variants of category symbols M1, N1, L1, L2, L3 and L5, shall comply with this regulation.

Similar Paragraphs.Text: An onboard speedometer and odometer complying with the requirements of this Regulation shall be fitted to the vehicle to be approved.

If the vehicle conforms to a vehicle type approved under one or more other Regulations annexed to the Agreement in the country which has granted approval under this Regulation, the symbol prescribed in paragraph 4.4.1 need not be repeated; in such a case the additional numbers and symbols of all the Regulations under which approval has been granted in the country which has granted approval under this Regulation shall be placed in vertical columns to the right of the symbol prescribed in paragraph 4.4.1.

The display of the odometer shall be visible or accessible to the driver. The odometer shall display at least an integer number composed of a minimum of 6 numerals for the vehicles of categories M and N, and at least an integer number composed of a minimum of 5 numerals for the vehicles of category L. Nevertheless, the Type Approval Authorities may also accept an integer number composed of at least 5 numerals for the vehicles of categories M and N if the intended use of the vehicle justifies it.

Paragraphs.Text: Effective date from 2008/1/1, the new vehicle variants of category symbols M2, M3, N2 and N3, and from 2010/1/1, all vehicle variants of category symbols M2, M3, N2 and N3, shall comply with this regulation.

Similar Paragraphs.Text: If the vehicle conforms to a vehicle type approved under one or more other Regulations annexed to the Agreement in the country which has granted approval under this Regulation, the symbol prescribed in paragraph 4.4.1 need not be repeated; in such a case the additional numbers and symbols of all the Regulations under which approval has been granted in the country which has granted approval under this Regulation shall be placed in vertical columns to the right of the symbol prescribed in paragraph 4.4.1.
An onboard speedometer and odometer complying with the requirements of this Regulation shall be fitted to the vehicle to be approved.

Nevertheless, the Type Approval Authorities may also accept an integer number composed of at least 5 numerals for the vehicles of categories M and N if the intended use of the vehicle justifies it.
SCOPE This Regulation applies to the approval of vehicles of categories L, M and N.

‘Unladen vehicle’ means the vehicle in running order, complete with fuel, coolant, lubricant, tools and a spare wheel (if provided as standard equipment by the vehicle manufacturer), carrying a driver weighing 75 kg, but no driver's mate, optional accessories or load.

Similar Paragraphs.Text: If the vehicle conforms to a vehicle type approved under one or more other Regulations annexed to the Agreement in the country which has granted approval under this Regulation, the symbol prescribed in paragraph 4.4.1 need not be repeated; in such a case the additional numbers and symbols of all the Regulations under which approval has been granted in the country which has granted approval under this Regulation shall be placed in vertical columns to the right of the symbol prescribed in paragraph 4.4.1.

Paragraphs.Text: The same axle set variant.

Similar Paragraphs.Text: The conformity of production procedures shall comply with those set out in the Agreement, Schedule 1 (E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.3), with the following requirements:

The test shall be carried out with the vehicle at its unladen weight. An additional weight can be carried for purposes of measurement. The weight of the vehicle and its distribution between the axles shall be indicated in the approval communication (see Annex 1, item 7);

In the case of vehicles of categories L1, L2 and L6 manufactured for sale in any country where imperial units are used, the speedometer shall also be marked in mph; the graduation shall be of 1, 2, 5 or 10 mph. The numerical values of the speed shall be indicated on the display at intervals not exceeding 10 mph and starting at 10 or 20 mph. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform. If a setting makes it possible for the driver to choose between the speed in km/h and mph, then the speed may be displayed only in km/h or mph at one time at any one time. The corresponding unit shall permanently be displayed.

Paragraphs.Text: The speedometer shall apply SI unit. The display of the speedometer must be located within the direct field of view of the driver and must be clearly legible both day and night.

Similar Paragraphs.Text: The display of the speedometer shall be located within the direct field of view of the driver and shall be clearly legible both day and night. The range of speeds displayed shall be sufficiently wide to include the maximum speed of this type of vehicle as stated by the manufacturer.
The approval mark shall be clearly legible and shall be indelible.
‘Speedometer’ means that part of the speedometer equipment which indicates to the driver the speed of his vehicle at any given moment; (2)

Paragraphs.Text: The speedometer graduation that from first graduation of indicated number shall be 1, 2, 5 or 10 km/h.

Similar Paragraphs.Text: The number of numerals.

An approval number shall be assigned to each type approved. The first two digits shall be the highest number of the series of amendments incorporated in the Regulation at the time of issue of the approval. The same Contracting Party may not assign the same number to another vehicle type subject to the provisions of paragraph 6 of this Regulation.
The number of this Regulation, followed by the letter ‘R’, a dash and the approval number to the right of the circle described in paragraph 4.4.1.

Paragraphs.Text: The numerical values of the speed shall be indicated on the display as follows:

Similar Paragraphs.Text: In the case of speedometers intended for vehicles of categories M, N, and L3, L4, L5, and L7, the graduation shall be 1, 2, 5 or 10 km/h. The numerical values of the speed shall be indicated on the display as follows: when the highest value on the display does not exceed 200 km/h, speed values shall be indicated at intervals not exceeding 20 km/h. When the maximum value on the display exceeds 200 km/h, then the speed values shall be indicated at intervals not exceeding 30 km/h. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform. If a setting makes it possible for the driver to choose between the speed in km/h and mph (miles per hour), then the speed may be displayed only in either km/h or mph at any one time. The corresponding unit shall permanently be displayed.

In the case of speedometers intended for vehicles of categories L1 (mopeds), L2, and L6, the display readings shall not exceed 80 km/h. The graduation shall be 1, 2, 5 or 10 km/h and the marked numerical values of the speed indicated shall not exceed 10 km/h. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform.

In the case of vehicles of categories L1, L2 and L6 manufactured for sale in any country where imperial units are used, the speedometer shall also be marked in mph; the graduation shall be of 1, 2, 5 or 10 mph. The numerical values of the speed shall be indicated on the display at intervals not exceeding 10 mph and starting at 10 or 20 mph. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform. If a setting makes it possible for the driver to choose between the speed in km/h and mph, then the speed may be displayed only in km/h or mph at one time at any one time. The corresponding unit shall permanently be displayed.

Paragraphs.Text: When the highest value on the display does not exceed 200 km/h, speed values shall be indicated at intervals not exceeding 20 km/h.  When the maximum value on the display exceeds 200 km/h, then the speed values shall be indicated at intervals not exceeding 30 km/h.

Similar Paragraphs.Text: In the case of speedometers intended for vehicles of categories M, N, and L3, L4, L5, and L7, the graduation shall be 1, 2, 5 or 10 km/h. The numerical values of the speed shall be indicated on the display as follows: when the highest value on the display does not exceed 200 km/h, speed values shall be indicated at intervals not exceeding 20 km/h. When the maximum value on the display exceeds 200 km/h, then the speed values shall be indicated at intervals not exceeding 30 km/h. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform. If a setting makes it possible for the driver to choose between the speed in km/h and mph (miles per hour), then the speed may be displayed only in either km/h or mph at any one time. The corresponding unit shall permanently be displayed.

In the case of speedometers intended for vehicles of categories L1 (mopeds), L2, and L6, the display readings shall not exceed 80 km/h. The graduation shall be 1, 2, 5 or 10 km/h and the marked numerical values of the speed indicated shall not exceed 10 km/h. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform.

In the case of vehicles of categories L1, L2 and L6 manufactured for sale in any country where imperial units are used, the speedometer shall also be marked in mph; the graduation shall be of 1, 2, 5 or 10 mph. The numerical values of the speed shall be indicated on the display at intervals not exceeding 10 mph and starting at 10 or 20 mph. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform. If a setting makes it possible for the driver to choose between the speed in km/h and mph, then the speed may be displayed only in km/h or mph at one time at any one time. The corresponding unit shall permanently be displayed.

Paragraphs.Text: In the case of speedometers intended for vehicles of category symbol L1 and L2, the display readings must not exceed 80 km/h, and the marked numerical values of the speed indicated shall not exceed 10 km/h.

Similar Paragraphs.Text: In the case of speedometers intended for vehicles of categories L1 (mopeds), L2, and L6, the display readings shall not exceed 80 km/h. The graduation shall be 1, 2, 5 or 10 km/h and the marked numerical values of the speed indicated shall not exceed 10 km/h. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform.

In the case of speedometers intended for vehicles of categories M, N, and L3, L4, L5, and L7, the graduation shall be 1, 2, 5 or 10 km/h. The numerical values of the speed shall be indicated on the display as follows: when the highest value on the display does not exceed 200 km/h, speed values shall be indicated at intervals not exceeding 20 km/h. When the maximum value on the display exceeds 200 km/h, then the speed values shall be indicated at intervals not exceeding 30 km/h. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform. If a setting makes it possible for the driver to choose between the speed in km/h and mph (miles per hour), then the speed may be displayed only in either km/h or mph at any one time. The corresponding unit shall permanently be displayed.

In the case of vehicles of categories M, N, and L3, L4, L5, and L7 manufactured for sale in any country where imperial units are used, the speedometer shall also be marked in miles per hour (mph); the graduations shall be of 1, 2, 5 or 10 mph. The speed may be displayed either in km/h or mph at any one time provided that a setting makes it possible for the driver to choose between the speed in km/h and mph, in that case the corresponding unit shall permanently be displayed. The numerical values of the speed shall be indicated on the display at intervals not exceeding 20 mph and commencing at 10 or 20 mph. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform.

Paragraphs.Text: The test shall be carried out with the vehicle at its unladen weight (curb vehicle + driver + necessary instrument). The speed indicated shall not be less than the true speed of the vehicle. At the test speeds specified below, there shall be the relationship between the speed displayed (V1) and the true speed (V2): Maximum design speed (Vmax) of the vehicle specified by the vehicle manufacturer (km/h) Test speed (V1) (km/h) Vmax45 80% of Vmax 45 < Vmax100 40 km/h and 80 % Vmax (if the resulting speed is 55 km/h) 100 < Vmax150 40 km/h, 80 km/h and 80 % Vmax (if the resulting speed is 100 km/h) 150 < Vmax 40 km/h, 80 km/h and 120 km/h

Paragraphs.Text: Definitions:

Similar Paragraphs.Text: DEFINITIONS For the purposes of this Regulation:

The test shall be carried out with the vehicle at its unladen weight. An additional weight can be carried for purposes of measurement. The weight of the vehicle and its distribution between the axles shall be indicated in the approval communication (see Annex 1, item 7);
Every vehicle approved under this Regulation shall be so manufactured as to conform to the type approved by meeting the requirements of the relevant part(s) of this Regulation.

Paragraphs.Text: "Tyres normally fitted" means the type or types of tyre provided by the manufacturer on the vehicle type in question; snow tyres shall not be regarded as tyres normally fitted;

Similar Paragraphs.Text: ‘Tyres normally fitted’ means the type or types of tyre provided by the manufacturer on the vehicle type in question; snow tyres shall not be regarded as tyres normally fitted;
The size designation of the tyres chosen from the range of tyres normally fitted;

The tyres shall be one of the types normally fitted to the vehicle as defined in paragraph 2.3 of this Regulation. A test shall be carried out for each type of speedometer intended to be fitted by the manufacturer.

Paragraphs.Text: "Normal running pressure" means the cold inflation pressure specified by the vehicle manufacturer increased by 0.2 bar;

Similar Paragraphs.Text: ‘Normal running pressure’ means the cold inflation pressure specified by the vehicle manufacturer increased by 0,2 bar;
During each test the pressure of the tyres shall be the normal running pressure as defined in paragraph 2.4;
‘Tyres normally fitted’ means the type or types of tyre provided by the manufacturer on the vehicle type in question; snow tyres shall not be regarded as tyres normally fitted;

Paragraphs.Text: "Speedometer" means that part of the speedometer equipment which indicates to the driver the speed of his vehicle at any given moment;

Similar Paragraphs.Text: ‘Speedometer’ means that part of the speedometer equipment which indicates to the driver the speed of his vehicle at any given moment; (2)
‘Odometer’ means that part of the odometer equipment which indicates to the driver the total distance recorded by the vehicle since its entry into service.

‘Tolerances of the speedometer's measuring mechanism’ shall mean the accuracy of the speedometer instrument itself, expressed as the upper and the lower speed indication limits for a range of speed inputs;

Paragraphs.Text: "Technical constant of the speedometer" shall mean the relationship between the input revolutions or pulses per minute and a specified displayed speed;

The tyres shall be one of the types normally fitted to the vehicle as defined in paragraph 2.3 of this Regulation. A test shall be carried out for each type of speedometer intended to be fitted by the manufacturer.

The display of the speedometer shall be located within the direct field of view of the driver and shall be clearly legible both day and night. The range of speeds displayed shall be sufficiently wide to include the maximum speed of this type of vehicle as stated by the manufacturer.
‘Approval of a vehicle’ means the approval of a vehicle type with regard to the speedometer and odometer equipment including its installation.

The number of this Regulation, followed by the letter ‘R’, a dash and the approval number to the right of the circle described in paragraph 4.4.1.

An approval number shall be assigned to each type approved. The first two digits shall be the highest number of the series of amendments incorporated in the Regulation at the time of issue of the approval. The same Contracting Party may not assign the same number to another vehicle type subject to the provisions of paragraph 6 of this Regulation.

Paragraphs.Text: When applicants apply for certification testing shall provide at least one representative vehicle or chassis vehicle (or the essential part of vehicle for testing) and submit the documents as below to technical services:

Similar Paragraphs.Text: An unladen vehicle representative of the vehicle type to be approved shall be submitted to the technical service conducting approval tests.

The application for approval of a vehicle type with regard to the speedometer and odometer equipment including its installation shall be submitted by the vehicle manufacturer or by his duly accredited representative.
Require a further test report from the Technical Service responsible for conducting the tests.

Every vehicle approved under this Regulation shall be so manufactured as to conform to the type approved by meeting the requirements of the relevant part(s) of this Regulation.
Every modification of the vehicle type shall be communicated to the Type Approval Authority which approved the vehicle type. The Authority may then either:

Paragraphs.Text: Specifications

Similar Paragraphs.Text: SPECIFICATIONS
The tolerances of the speedometer's measuring mechanism;

To every vehicle conforming to a vehicle type approved under this Regulation there shall be affixed in a conspicuous and easily accessible position, specified on the approval form, an international approval mark consisting of:

Paragraphs.Text: An onboard speedometer and odometer complying with the requirements of this Regulation shall be fitted to the vehicle to be approved.

Similar Paragraphs.Text: An onboard speedometer and odometer complying with the requirements of this Regulation shall be fitted to the vehicle to be approved.
Every vehicle approved under this Regulation shall be so manufactured as to conform to the type approved by meeting the requirements of the relevant part(s) of this Regulation.

If the vehicle type submitted for approval pursuant to this Regulation meets the requirements of the Regulation in respect of the speedometer and odometer equipment including its installation, approval of that vehicle type shall be granted.

Paragraphs.Text: The display of the speedometer must be located within the direct field of view of the driver and must be clearly legible both day and night. The range of speeds displayed must be sufficiently wide to include the maximum speed of this type of vehicle as stated by the manufacturer.

Similar Paragraphs.Text: The display of the speedometer shall be located within the direct field of view of the driver and shall be clearly legible both day and night. The range of speeds displayed shall be sufficiently wide to include the maximum speed of this type of vehicle as stated by the manufacturer.
The range of speeds displayed.

The speed indicated shall not be less than the true speed of the vehicle. At the test speeds specified in paragraph 5.3.5 above, there shall be the following relationship between the speed displayed (V1) and the true speed (V2).

Paragraphs.Text: The numerical values of the speed shall be indicated on the display as follows :

Similar Paragraphs.Text: In the case of speedometers intended for vehicles of categories M, N, and L3, L4, L5, and L7, the graduation shall be 1, 2, 5 or 10 km/h. The numerical values of the speed shall be indicated on the display as follows: when the highest value on the display does not exceed 200 km/h, speed values shall be indicated at intervals not exceeding 20 km/h. When the maximum value on the display exceeds 200 km/h, then the speed values shall be indicated at intervals not exceeding 30 km/h. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform. If a setting makes it possible for the driver to choose between the speed in km/h and mph (miles per hour), then the speed may be displayed only in either km/h or mph at any one time. The corresponding unit shall permanently be displayed.

In the case of speedometers intended for vehicles of categories L1 (mopeds), L2, and L6, the display readings shall not exceed 80 km/h. The graduation shall be 1, 2, 5 or 10 km/h and the marked numerical values of the speed indicated shall not exceed 10 km/h. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform.

In the case of vehicles of categories L1, L2 and L6 manufactured for sale in any country where imperial units are used, the speedometer shall also be marked in mph; the graduation shall be of 1, 2, 5 or 10 mph. The numerical values of the speed shall be indicated on the display at intervals not exceeding 10 mph and starting at 10 or 20 mph. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform. If a setting makes it possible for the driver to choose between the speed in km/h and mph, then the speed may be displayed only in km/h or mph at one time at any one time. The corresponding unit shall permanently be displayed.

Paragraphs.Text: In the case of speedometers intended for vehicles of categories M, N, L3, and L5,the graduation shall be 1, 2, 5 or 10 km/h. The numerical values of the speed shall be indicated on the display as follows: when the highest value on the display does not exceed 200 km/h, speed values shall be indicated at intervals not exceeding 20 km/h. When the maximum value on the display exceeds 200 km/h, then the speed values shall be indicated at intervals not exceeding 30 km/h. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform.

Similar Paragraphs.Text: In the case of speedometers intended for vehicles of categories M, N, and L3, L4, L5, and L7, the graduation shall be 1, 2, 5 or 10 km/h. The numerical values of the speed shall be indicated on the display as follows: when the highest value on the display does not exceed 200 km/h, speed values shall be indicated at intervals not exceeding 20 km/h. When the maximum value on the display exceeds 200 km/h, then the speed values shall be indicated at intervals not exceeding 30 km/h. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform. If a setting makes it possible for the driver to choose between the speed in km/h and mph (miles per hour), then the speed may be displayed only in either km/h or mph at any one time. The corresponding unit shall permanently be displayed.

In the case of speedometers intended for vehicles of categories L1 (mopeds), L2, and L6, the display readings shall not exceed 80 km/h. The graduation shall be 1, 2, 5 or 10 km/h and the marked numerical values of the speed indicated shall not exceed 10 km/h. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform.

In the case of vehicles of categories M, N, and L3, L4, L5, and L7 manufactured for sale in any country where imperial units are used, the speedometer shall also be marked in miles per hour (mph); the graduations shall be of 1, 2, 5 or 10 mph. The speed may be displayed either in km/h or mph at any one time provided that a setting makes it possible for the driver to choose between the speed in km/h and mph, in that case the corresponding unit shall permanently be displayed. The numerical values of the speed shall be indicated on the display at intervals not exceeding 20 mph and commencing at 10 or 20 mph. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform.

Paragraphs.Text: In the case of speedometers intended for vehicles of categories L1 (mopeds) and L2, the display readings must not exceed 80 km/h. The graduation shall be 1, 2, 5 or 10 km/h and the marked numerical values of the speed indicated shall not exceed 10 km/h. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform.

Similar Paragraphs.Text: In the case of speedometers intended for vehicles of categories L1 (mopeds), L2, and L6, the display readings shall not exceed 80 km/h. The graduation shall be 1, 2, 5 or 10 km/h and the marked numerical values of the speed indicated shall not exceed 10 km/h. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform.

In the case of speedometers intended for vehicles of categories M, N, and L3, L4, L5, and L7, the graduation shall be 1, 2, 5 or 10 km/h. The numerical values of the speed shall be indicated on the display as follows: when the highest value on the display does not exceed 200 km/h, speed values shall be indicated at intervals not exceeding 20 km/h. When the maximum value on the display exceeds 200 km/h, then the speed values shall be indicated at intervals not exceeding 30 km/h. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform. If a setting makes it possible for the driver to choose between the speed in km/h and mph (miles per hour), then the speed may be displayed only in either km/h or mph at any one time. The corresponding unit shall permanently be displayed.

In the case of vehicles of categories M, N, and L3, L4, L5, and L7 manufactured for sale in any country where imperial units are used, the speedometer shall also be marked in miles per hour (mph); the graduations shall be of 1, 2, 5 or 10 mph. The speed may be displayed either in km/h or mph at any one time provided that a setting makes it possible for the driver to choose between the speed in km/h and mph, in that case the corresponding unit shall permanently be displayed. The numerical values of the speed shall be indicated on the display at intervals not exceeding 20 mph and commencing at 10 or 20 mph. The indicated numerical speed value intervals need not be uniform.

Paragraphs.Text: The accuracy of the speedometer equipment shall be tested in accordance with the following procedure:

Similar Paragraphs.Text: The accuracy of the speedometer equipment shall be tested in accordance with the following procedure:
The conformity of production procedures shall comply with those set out in the Agreement, Schedule 1 (E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.3), with the following requirements:
The vehicle is tested at the following speeds:

Paragraphs.Text: The tyres shall be one of the types normally fitted to the vehicle as defined  Paragraph-. of this Regulation. A test shall be carried out for each type of speedometer intended to be fitted by the manufacturer.

Similar Paragraphs.Text: The tyres shall be one of the types normally fitted to the vehicle as defined in paragraph 2.3 of this Regulation. A test shall be carried out for each type of speedometer intended to be fitted by the manufacturer.
‘Tyres normally fitted’ means the type or types of tyre provided by the manufacturer on the vehicle type in question; snow tyres shall not be regarded as tyres normally fitted;
The size designation of the tyres chosen from the range of tyres normally fitted;

Paragraphs.Text: The test shall be carried out with the vehicle at its unladen weight. An additional weight can be carried for purposes of measurement. The weight of the vehicle and its distribution between the axles shall be indicated in the approval communication;

Similar Paragraphs.Text: The test shall be carried out with the vehicle at its unladen weight. An additional weight can be carried for purposes of measurement. The weight of the vehicle and its distribution between the axles shall be indicated in the approval communication (see Annex 1, item 7);

For each type of vehicle sufficient checks are carried out regarding the speedometer equipment and its installation; in particular, for each type of vehicle at least the test prescribed in Annex 3 to this Regulation shall be carried out.

‘Unladen vehicle’ means the vehicle in running order, complete with fuel, coolant, lubricant, tools and a spare wheel (if provided as standard equipment by the vehicle manufacturer), carrying a driver weighing 75 kg, but no driver's mate, optional accessories or load.

Paragraphs.Text: The reference temperature at the speedometer shall be 23 +/- 5 degrees C; applicants may be claim based on the situations at real time.

Similar Paragraphs.Text: The reference temperature at the speedometer shall be 23 ± 5 °C;
APPLICATION FOR APPROVAL

The Authority, which has granted type approval, may at any time verify the conformity control methods applied in each production facility. The normal frequency of these verifications shall be once every two years.

Paragraphs.Text: During each test the pressure of the tyres shall be the normal running pressure as define  Paragraph-.

Similar Paragraphs.Text: During each test the pressure of the tyres shall be the normal running pressure as defined in paragraph 2.4;
‘Normal running pressure’ means the cold inflation pressure specified by the vehicle manufacturer increased by 0,2 bar;
The size designation of the tyres chosen from the range of tyres normally fitted;

Paragraphs.Text: The vehicle is tested at the following speeds:

Similar Paragraphs.Text: The vehicle is tested at the following speeds:

The speed indicated shall not be less than the true speed of the vehicle. At the test speeds specified in paragraph 5.3.5 above, there shall be the following relationship between the speed displayed (V1) and the true speed (V2).
The range of speeds displayed.

Paragraphs.Text: the test instrumentation used for measuring the true vehicle speed shall be accurate to +/- 0.5 per cent;

Similar Paragraphs.Text: The test instrumentation used for measuring the true vehicle speed shall be accurate to ± 0,5 per cent;
‘Technical constant of the speedometer’ shall mean the relationship between the input revolutions or pulses per minute and a specified displayed speed;

The speed indicated shall not be less than the true speed of the vehicle. At the test speeds specified in paragraph 5.3.5 above, there shall be the following relationship between the speed displayed (V1) and the true speed (V2).

Paragraphs.Text: the surface of a test track when used shall be flat and dry, and provide sufficient adhesion;

The test instrumentation used for measuring the true vehicle speed shall be accurate to ± 0,5 per cent;

The vehicle is tested at the following speeds:

Paragraphs.Text: The display of the odometer shall be visible or accessible to the driver. The odometer shall display at least an integer number  composed of a minimum of 6 numerals for the vehicles of categories M and N, and at least an integer number composed of a minimum of 5 numerals for the vehicles of category L. Nevertheless, the Type Approval Authorities may also accept an integer number composed of at least 5 numerals for the vehicles of categories M and N if the intended use of the vehicle justifies it.

Similar Paragraphs.Text: The display of the odometer shall be visible or accessible to the driver. The odometer shall display at least an integer number composed of a minimum of 6 numerals for the vehicles of categories M and N, and at least an integer number composed of a minimum of 5 numerals for the vehicles of category L. Nevertheless, the Type Approval Authorities may also accept an integer number composed of at least 5 numerals for the vehicles of categories M and N if the intended use of the vehicle justifies it.
The number of numerals.
SCOPE This Regulation applies to the approval of vehicles of categories L, M and N.
